Text: Can someone tell me how to get these books onto my Kindle for iPad?

plug kindle into laptop-open
open folder(s)
click onto mobi format
drag and drop into contents (where books are held)
done
That works for iPad?  Will it automatically put it in my Kindle library?

Alternatively, you can manage content on your Kindle by using a brilliant bit of software called Calibre. It is legal software and it is free to download and use too! As well as managing content it also converts any format eBook to the format of your reader, so you can download ePub and convert it to Mobi. It does loads of other stuff too, I read about it on here so I am passing on the tip. Can't recommend it highly enough.

yes i use calibre too,i find it very good.
i also have aprox 8,000 kindle books,if anyone wants them i will u/l,it is aprox 5.50gig,but somehow i don`t think people on this site will seed back

Karaokeking,
Please do put up the books! and I promise I'll seed!
